medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in his usual health until 4 days before admission, when he developed increasing fatigue, malaise, headache, intermittent testicular discomfort, yellowed eyes, dark urine, nausea, and diffuse body aches. Chronic leg pain also worsened. No fever, rash, hematuria, dysuria, melena, or neurologic symptoms were present.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Intermittent asthma, acne, chronic leg pain. A history of fractures of the right leg after a motor vehicle accident requiring internal fixation of the tibia for nonunion and bone and skin grafting. A previous episode of acute anemia occurred after tibial surgery. No known allergies to medication.
medical_history.family_history: His mother had osteopenia; his father and four other siblings were healthy. His 14-year-old brother died of an unspecified disease.
medical_history.social_history: The patient emigrated from North Africa to the United States 9 years earlier. He was a student, smoked marijuana and cigarettes, and reported no current alcohol or intravenous drug use. He was sexually active with his girlfriend. During his trip to North Africa, he was exposed to sheep and drank unpasteurized cowâ€™s milk.
